results.title: Broad shots
results.brief_description: Broad Shots was made by a group of young women from Broadmeadows as part of the Broadmeadows Healthy Localities Project, a local youth health promotion project. It looks at the issue of violence against young women through a series of interviews, skits and voxpops. “Broad Shots” is funny and fast and is a good starting point for discussion on domestic violence, sexual harassment and assertiveness. It is targeted at young people aged 13 to 16 years. Also contains appearances by comediennes Judith Lucy and Magda Szubanski.

results.title: Broad daylight
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Derrick Knight
results.brief_description: The development and use of patent glazing from Victorian times to the present day. Shows how patent glazing derived from the needs of expanding Victorian industry, and how it developed techniques so that today it remains completely adaptable to the demands of contemporary design.

results.title: British Transport Films. 1. The Classics
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films and Edgar H. Anstey
results.brief_description: British Transport Films (BTF) began in May 1949 boasting one of Britain’s leading documentary filmmakers, Edgar Anstey, as its head. Between 1950 and 1980 a huge range of quality films were produced with many gaining top awards at various film festivals. This is a compilation of a selection of four films, digitally remastered by the British Film Institute, demonstrating the diversity and high calibre of BTF as a production company. Elizabethan express: From King’s Cross Station, London, to Waverley Station, Edinburgh, is 393 miles. The Elizabethan - a summertime express - does this journey in six and a half hours non-stop - the longest daily non-stop run in the world to be timed at over 60 mph in 1954. This film is about one of those runs and the people behind the service. (See also Title Code 003232 16mm) Snowdrift at Bleath Gill: A freight train becomes snowbound in the West-Morland hills in Northern England. The Motive Power, Operating and Engineering Departments of British Transport go to work with snow-ploughs to reach the trapped train. Working through the night the team dig clear, and thaw out moving parts, and finally two engines help to clear the line. (See also Title Code 009948 16mm) Train time: An account of the operation of British Railways. The integration of goods and passenger services calls for a constant review of time-tables to meet the varying local needs. (See also Title Code 011098 16mm) Forward to first principles: Tells the history of freight railways and the laying of iron lines, of the impact on the geography and landscape of Great Britain and of the age of computer technology and remote control replacing manual labour.

results.title: British scrapbook. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Directorate of Army Kinematography (The War Office)
results.brief_description: A scrapbook look at World War II using some captured enemy film, but mostly film shot by the military cameramen of the forces of the United Nations. Part one: June 1940-October 1942; Part two: November 1942-December 1944.

results.title: British locomotives
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Humphrey Swingler, G. Buckland-Smith and Clifford Hornby
results.brief_description: The development of the British locomotive from 1825 to the latest and most powerful diesel and electric locomotive. Shows British Railway’s modernisation plan, different categories of locomotives and rolling stock, specially produced for overseas markets, in operation in different parts of the world.

results.title: British Empire Games, 1950
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the opening and closing ceremonies of the 1950 British Empire Games held in Auckland, New Zealand and covers many of the sporting events including track and field, boxing, weight-lifting, fencing and rowing.

results.title: British Columbia: mountains to the sea
results.brief_description: A picturesque film that explores the different wild environments of British Columbia. The film records the change of the seasons and the effects that the changes have on the many species of wildlife and their habitats.
results.description: A picturesque film that explores the different wild environments of British Columbia. The film records the change of the seasons and the effects that the changes have on the many species of wildlife and their habitats.

results.title: Britannia: a bridge
results.creator_credit: Visionaire Productions, British Transport Films, John Shearman and David Lochner
results.brief_description: Menai Strait was completely gutted by fire in 1970. The reconstruction work included steel arches over the seaway and the use of the masonry piers which were a major feature of the original bridge

results.title: Britain welcomes the President of India
results.brief_description: The visit to Britain by the President of India Dr Radhakrishnan. In London he accompanied the Queen on a State drive, visited the Commonwealth Institute, attended a Guildhall luncheon and visited the country.
